intro: Apoda-prorepentia calypso, commonly known as the Moonflower Vine, is a tropical climbing plant characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to the rainforests of Central and South America. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are woody and capable of climbing. The flowers emit a strong fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Due to its unique blooming pattern and aesthetic appeal, it is a popular ornamental plant in warm climates.
